ray.rage.asset.mesh

Class SubMesh

  • java.lang.Object
    • ray.rage.asset.mesh.SubMesh
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Disposable, Nameable

    public final class SubMesh
extends java.lang.Object
implements Nameable, Disposable
    A sub-mesh defines a part of a mesh.

    Sub-Meshes exist because a single mesh may be using multiple materials and each sub-mesh can have its own material file name specified.

    Sub-Meshes have a 1:1 relationship with sub-entities and provide the actual data that allow sub-entities to be rendered.

    Author:
    Raymond L. Rivera
    See Also:
    Mesh, SubEntity

      • notifyDispose

        public void notifyDispose()
        Description copied from interface: Disposable
        Explicitly releases the internal resources held by this instance, making it unusable afterwards.

        WARNING: This method is meant to be used internally by the framework and not by game clients. Use directly only if you really know what you're doing.

        Specified by:
        notifyDispose in interface Disposable
